verses.verse: And Jacob<WH3290> called<WH7121> unto his sons<WH1121>, and said<WH559>, Gather yourselves together<WH622>, that I may tell<WH5046> you that which shall befall<WH7122> you in the last<WH319> days<WH3117>.
Gather yourselves together<WH6908>, and hear<WH8085>, ye sons<WH1121> of Jacob<WH3290>; and hearken<WH8085> unto Israel<WH3478> your father<WH1>.

Reuben<WH7205>, thou art my firstborn<WH1060>, my might<WH3581>, and the beginning<WH7225> of my strength<WH202>, the excellency<WH3499> of dignity<WH7613>, and the excellency<WH3499> of power<WH5794>:

Unstable<WH6349> as water<WH4325>, thou shalt not excel<WH3498>; because thou wentest up<WH5927> to thy father's<WH1> bed<WH4904>; then defiledst thou<WH2490> it: he went up<WH5927> to my couch<WH3326>. thou shalt: Heb. do not thou excel he went: or, my couch is gone
Simeon<WH8095> and Levi<WH3878> are brethren<WH251>; instruments<WH3627> of cruelty<WH2555> are in their habitations<WH4380>. instruments: or, their swords are weapons of violence

O my soul<WH5315>, come<WH935> not thou into their secret<WH5475>; unto their assembly<WH6951>, mine honour<WH3519>, be not thou united<WH3161>: for in their anger<WH639> they slew<WH2026> a man<WH376>, and in their selfwill<WH7522> they digged down<WH6131> a wall<WH7794>. digged: or, houghed oxen

Cursed<WH779> be their anger<WH639>, for it was fierce<WH5794>; and their wrath<WH5678>, for it was cruel<WH7185>: I will divide<WH2505> them in Jacob<WH3290>, and scatter<WH6327> them in Israel<WH3478>.

Judah<WH3063>, thou art he whom thy brethren<WH251> shall praise<WH3034>: thy hand<WH3027> shall be in the neck<WH6203> of thine enemies<WH341>; thy father's<WH1> children<WH1121> shall bow down<WH7812> before thee.

Judah<WH3063> is a lion's<WH738> whelp<WH1482>: from the prey<WH2964>, my son<WH1121>, thou art gone up<WH5927>: he stooped down<WH3766>, he couched<WH7257> as a lion<WH738>, and as an old lion<WH3833>; who shall rouse him up<WH6965>?

The sceptre<WH7626> shall not depart<WH5493> from Judah<WH3063>, nor a lawgiver<WH2710> from between his feet<WH7272>, until<WH3588> Shiloh<WH7886> come<WH935>; and unto him shall the gathering<WH3349> of the people<WH5971> be.

Binding<WH631> his foal<WH5895> unto the vine<WH1612>, and his ass's<WH860> colt<WH1121> unto the choice vine<WH8321>; he washed<WH3526> his garments<WH3830> in wine<WH3196>, and his clothes<WH5497> in the blood<WH1818> of grapes<WH6025>:
His eyes<WH5869> shall be red<WH2447> with wine<WH3196>, and his teeth<WH8127> white<WH3836> with milk<WH2461>.
Zebulun<WH2074> shall dwell<WH7931> at the haven<WH2348> of the sea<WH3220>; and he shall be for an haven<WH2348> of ships<WH591>; and his border<WH3411> shall be unto Zidon<WH6721>.
Issachar<WH3485> is a strong<WH1634> ass<WH2543> couching down<WH7257> between two burdens<WH4942>:

And he saw<WH7200> that rest<WH4496> was good<WH2896>, and the land<WH776> that it was pleasant<WH5276>; and bowed<WH5186> his shoulder<WH7926> to bear<WH5445>, and became a servant<WH5647> unto tribute<WH4522>.
Dan<WH1835> shall judge<WH1777> his people<WH5971>, as one<WH259> of the tribes<WH7626> of Israel<WH3478>.

Dan<WH1835> shall be a serpent<WH5175> by the way<WH1870>, an adder<WH8207> in the path<WH734>, that biteth<WH5391> the horse<WH5483> heels<WH6119>, so that his rider<WH7392> shall fall<WH5307> backward<WH268>. an adder: Heb. an arrow-snake
I have waited for<WH6960> thy salvation<WH3444>, O LORD<WH3068>.
Gad<WH1410>, a troop<WH1416> shall overcome<WH1464> him: but he shall overcome<WH1464> at the last<WH6119>.
Out of Asher<WH836> his bread<WH3899> shall be fat<WH8082>, and he shall yield<WH5414> royal<WH4428> dainties<WH4574>.
Naphtali<WH5321> is a hind<WH355> let loose<WH7971>: he giveth<WH5414> goodly<WH8233> words<WH561>.
Joseph<WH3130> is a fruitful<WH6509> bough<WH1121>, even a fruitful<WH6509> bough<WH1121> by a well<WH5869>; whose branches<WH1323> run<WH6805> over the wall<WH7791>: branches: Heb. daughters
The archers<WH1167> <WH2671> have sorely grieved him<WH4843>, and shot<WH7232> at him, and hated him<WH7852>:

But his bow<WH7198> abode<WH3427> in strength<WH386>, and the arms<WH2220> of his hands<WH3027> were made strong<WH6339> by the hands<WH3027> of the mighty<WH46> God of Jacob<WH3290>; (from thence is the shepherd<WH7462>, the stone<WH68> of Israel<WH3478>:)

Even by the God<WH410> of thy father<WH1>, who shall help<WH5826> thee; and by<WH854> the Almighty<WH7706>, who shall bless<WH1288> thee with blessings<WH1293> of heaven<WH8064> above<WH5920>, blessings<WH1293> of the deep<WH8415> that lieth<WH7257> under, blessings<WH1293> of the breasts<WH7699>, and of the womb<WH7356>:

The blessings<WH1293> of thy father<WH1> have prevailed<WH1396> above the blessings<WH1293> of my progenitors<WH2029> unto the utmost bound<WH8379> of the everlasting<WH5769> hills<WH1389>: they shall be on the head<WH7218> of Joseph<WH3130>, and on the crown of the head<WH6936> of him that was separate<WH5139> from his brethren<WH251>.
Benjamin<WH1144> shall ravin<WH2963> as a wolf<WH2061>: in the morning<WH1242> he shall devour<WH398> the prey<WH5706>, and at night<WH6153> he shall divide<WH2505> the spoil<WH7998>.

All these are the twelve<WH6240> <WH8147> tribes<WH7626> of Israel<WH3478>: and this is it that their father<WH1> spake<WH1696> unto them, and blessed<WH1288> them; every<WH834> one<WH376> according to his blessing<WH1293> he blessed<WH1288> them.

And he charged<WH6680> them, and said<WH559> unto them, I am to be gathered<WH622> unto my people<WH5971>: bury<WH6912> me with my fathers<WH1> in the cave<WH4631> that is in the field<WH7704> of Ephron<WH6085> the Hittite<WH2850>,

In the cave<WH4631> that is in the field<WH7704> of Machpelah<WH4375>, which is before<WH6440> Mamre<WH4471>, in the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667>, which Abraham<WH85> bought<WH7069> with the field<WH7704> of Ephron<WH6085> the Hittite<WH2850> for a possession<WH272> of a buryingplace<WH6913>.
There they buried<WH6912> Abraham<WH85> and Sarah<WH8283> his wife<WH802>; there they buried<WH6912> Isaac<WH3327> and Rebekah<WH7259> his wife<WH802>; and there I buried<WH6912> Leah<WH3812>.
The purchase<WH4735> of the field<WH7704> and of the cave<WH4631> that is therein was from the children<WH1121> of Heth<WH2845>.

And when Jacob<WH3290> had made an end<WH3615> of commanding<WH6680> his sons<WH1121>, he gathered up<WH622> his feet<WH7272> into the bed<WH4296>, and yielded up the ghost<WH1478>, and was gathered<WH622> unto his people<WH5971>.
